name: Dog Sprayed by Skunk
description: Steps to take if your dog has been sprayed by a skunk.
immediateActions: Keep your dog outside to prevent the smell from spreading indoors.
Check your dog's eyes for redness or irritation. If affected, rinse gently with cool water or pet-safe eyewash.

steps.title: Gather Supplies
steps.details: You'll need: Rubber gloves, old towels, skunk shampoo (or a de-skunking solution: 1 quart of 3% hydrogen peroxide solution, 1/4 cup baking soda, 1 teaspoon liquid dish soap). Mix solution right before use, do not store.

steps.title: Apply Solution (Avoid Eyes)
steps.details: Wearing gloves, apply the de-skunking solution to your dog's dry fur, avoiding the eyes and mouth. Lather well and let it sit for 5-10 minutes. Be careful, peroxide can bleach fur.

steps.title: Rinse Thoroughly
steps.details: Rinse your dog completely with lukewarm water. Ensure all solution is removed.

steps.title: Wash with Pet Shampoo
steps.details: Follow up with a regular pet shampoo to remove any residue.

steps.title: Towel Dry
steps.details: Dry your dog thoroughly with old towels.

steps.title: Monitor Your Dog
steps.details: Watch for any signs of illness, irritation, or excessive drooling. Contact your vet if concerned.

name: Found a Stray Animal
description: What to do if you find a lost or stray pet.
immediateActions: Approach cautiously. The animal may be scared or injured.
If the animal appears aggressive or you feel unsafe, do not approach. Call animal control.
Check for a collar and ID tags.

steps.title: Provide Safety (If Possible)
steps.details: If safe to do so, confine the animal in a secure area (e.g., fenced yard, garage, crate) with fresh water. Keep separate from your own pets.

steps.title: Check for Microchip
steps.details: Take the animal to a local vet clinic or animal shelter to scan for a microchip. This is usually a free service.

steps.title: Notify Local Shelters & Animal Control
steps.details: Report the found animal to San Diego Humane Society, County Animal Services, and other local shelters. Provide a description, location found, and your contact info.

steps.title: Use Social Media & Online Resources
steps.details: Post on local lost & found pet groups (e.g., Facebook, Nextdoor, PawBoost, Petco Love Lost). Include a photo, location, and date found.

steps.title: Put Up Flyers
steps.details: Consider putting up 'Found Pet' flyers in the neighborhood where the animal was found.

name: Rattlesnake Bite on Pet
description: Critical steps if your pet is bitten by a rattlesnake.
immediateActions: Stay calm, but act quickly. Keep your pet as still and quiet as possible.
Identify the snake if possible, but DO NOT attempt to catch or kill it.
Immediately seek veterinary attention. This is a life-threatening emergency.

steps.title: Go to a Vet IMMEDIATELY
steps.details: This is the most critical step. Call ahead to the nearest emergency vet to let them know you are coming. Antivenom is often needed.

steps.title: Keep Bite Area Below Heart Level
steps.details: If possible, try to keep the bitten area lower than the level of the pet's heart.

steps.title: DO NOT Do These Things
steps.details: DO NOT apply a tourniquet. DO NOT cut the wound. DO NOT try to suck out venom. DO NOT apply ice or heat. DO NOT give any medications unless directed by a vet.

steps.title: Note Time of Bite
steps.details: Try to remember the approximate time the bite occurred.
